intro: Cotoneaster vulgaris var. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to central and southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features small, ovate leaves that are dark green on top and pale underneath. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal display. Cotoneaster vulgaris var. intermedius thrives in well-drained soil and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
